content.description:
Yardarm is the route just left of the Peg Leg (5.9), and is easily indentified having the leftmost bolt in the "base" area.  If you head up this bolt and continue straight up (instead of moving left once you get to the top anchors halfway up), this is Yardarm.

The first section, which is shared with several other climbs goes at 5.11a/b, though it's a tough 5.11a/b.  Continue up through a simpler less than vertical section, and move into an overhung crux section about 55 feet off the ground.

Once into the crux, you'll realize very quickly why the route is called Yardarm.

The longest route on shipwreck wall, you'll run into some crummy rock up above the crux that's covered in bird crap.
content.protection: 10 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.  A 60 meter rope is required to lower on one rope.

content.description: Skaliwag is found furthest on the right side of the wall, just before you drop off into the ocean abyss. To avoid the ocean abyss, you must be a Skaliwag and send the exciting starting moves (PG-13) or stick clip for safety.

This slightly overhung route makes an excellent warmup, if you're planning on doing many other climbs on the Shipwreck Wall (seeing as how they're mostly 5.12s).

To find this climb, look just to the right of the flake chimney at the left side of Shipwreck Wall. Follow the bolt line following the climb about 20' shorter than any nearby.

Climb Lost at Sea to the ledge. Instead of going to the anchor of Skalliwag as you would with Lost at Sea, head up and left toward the crux of Avalon. A HARD boulder problem off of the ledge gives way to fantastic holds on perfect rock before meeting up with Avalon above the big cave. The “R” rating comes from the ledge fall potential.
content.location: Extension of Lost at Sea, which lives between Avalon and Skalliwag.

content.description: Start Conquistador and traverse left below the bathtub onto the Patriot. Climb to the top! Mega!
content.location:
Same start as Conquistador and Yardarm.

Go left at the “Bathtub”.

content.description: This is one of the more sustained pitches at Shipwreck. Follow the tricky seam into fantastic features on bullet sandstone bulges.
content.location: Left of Conquistador. Of the two routes that start on the pillar this is the rightmost.

content.description:
The climb starts on a steeper face on small but good holds, and offers pretty sustained 5.10 climbing.  A fun route, adding more intermediate climbing to an otherwise difficult area.

Facing Shipwreck Wall, climb the second furthest-right bolt line.

It's possible to confuse this route with Peg Leg if you're using the 2002 Bay Area Rock guidebook.  At the time of the guidebook's publication this route did not yet exist.  The confusion arises as it is the only other short bolted route on the wall.

A wander fest of the highest caliber! Very fun. Great position on the wall and without a doubt the best rock quality from start to finish of any route on the wall.

Recently re-bolted with bomber glue ins by Jordy Morgan and his accomplice Harry Rochford this route is ready to be climbed on again. This route will test your finger jamming skills and your head game. Great moves above the big cave!
content.location: Furthest left route on Shipwreck. Of the two routes that start on the pillar this is the bolt line to the left.

content.description: Awesome route with bouldery cruxes mixed with good rests!

This route heads directly up the front face on the longest part of the shipwreck wall, and is the next route right of the 5.9 wide crack climb known as Peg Leg.  The shiny top anchors can be seen from below on the highest section of sandstone above the center-right section of the black slab.

The first section heads up a slabby face for a few bolts and a 5.10bish move after the first bolt.

Climbing is simple until the crux, which is getting yourself through a diagonal crack system and over the bulge just after the small ledge 35 feet off the ground.  After the bulge, the climb has one more move that is on loose sandstone up near the top anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor. Bring slings for the last few bolts.
